field.name: navigation_mode
field.label: Scrolling Modes
field.description: Standard - all the special modes below are off. || Drag And Scroll: the full markup can be draged and scroller by holding the container with the mouse. || Page Scroll: by clicking left/right the slider with the current visible amount of entries will be slide to the left/right. || Carousel: Allows an endless slide through the entries

field.name: closeOtherOverlays
field.label: Auto Close Opened Details
field.description: If this set to 'on' than clickin a Reveal opener button will close first all other opened details within the same Teaser and open the clicked one. default value is 'off'

field.name: rewindFromEnd
field.label: Rewind From End
field.description: If end of the slide has been reached it rewinds to the first / last postions. Use this to make endless AutoScroll possible. Note: If the navigation mode set to 'Carousel', then this option will be disabled.

field.name: autoPlay
field.label: Auto Play
field.description: turn auto scroll on / off -> if Drag and Scroll is activated, auto scroll stops at the last slide

field.name: delay
field.label: Delay
field.description: AutoScroll Delay between two scrolls. Can be: 1000ms - 10000ms. (1 sec till 10sec can be any number).

field.name: speed
field.label: Speed
field.description: The speed of the slide moves (200 - 600)

field.name: navigation_type
field.label: Navigation Type
field.description: Choose the navigation visual from the template or a custom navigation buttons.

field.name: nav_template_id
field.label: Navigation Template
field.description: The template that set the look navigation buttons

field.name: nav_position
field.label: Navigation Position
field.description: Choose the navigation position: on the top or on the bottom.

field.name: left_buttonid
field.label: Left Button ID
field.description: The id of custom navigation left button. Example: carousel_left_button

field.name: right_buttonid
field.label: Right Button ID
field.description: The id of custom navigation right button. Example: carousel_right_button

field.name: text1
field.label: Defines how many Entry is visible in the different Responsive levels. The Reponsive levels (4 level!) are the following (the size of the Surrounding container and not the Browser !!!!)

field.name: visible_items_1
field.label: Num. Visible Items on 980px >
field.description: Number of visible items on more than 980px container width.

field.name: visible_items_2
field.label: Num. Visible Items 768px-980px
field.description: Number of visible items between 768px and 980px container width.

field.name: visible_items_3
field.label: Num. Visible Items 420px-768px
field.description: Number of visible items between 420px and 768px container width.

field.name: visible_items_4
field.label: Num. Visible Items < 420px
field.description: Number of visible items below 420px container width.

field.name: text2
field.label: Defines how height the mediaholder_innerwrap container can have depending on the Responsive levels.The Reponsive levels (4 level!) are the following (the size of the Surrounding container and not the Browser !!!!) 0 means no Limit!

field.name: media_height_1
field.label: Media Height on 980px >
field.description: Height of media holder on more than 980px container width.

field.name: media_height_2
field.label: Media Height on 768px-980px
field.description: Height of media holder between 768px and 980px container width.

field.name: media_height_3
field.label: Media Height on 420px-768px
field.description: Height of media holder between 420px and 768px container width.

field.name: media_height_4
field.label: Media Height on < 420px
field.description: Height of media holder below 420px container width.

field.name: heightOffsetBottom
field.label: Height Offset Bottom
field.description: Increase/decrease the height of the container (padding-bottom). Use it in case you add shadows / borders to entries. The overflow container padding can be adjusted with this value to be able to see the shadows on entries. default value is 0.

field.name: entrySizeOffset
field.label: Entry Size Offset
field.description: Reduce the width per entries. Dont need to adjust till entries fits always wll within the container. Default Value is 0

field.name: conteainerOffsetRight
field.label: Container Offset Right
field.description: Create a right padding and reduce the LI tag widths. Dont need to change till entries fits well in the surrounding container. Default value is 0

field.name: position
field.label: Position on the page
field.description: The position of the slider on the page, (float:left, float:right, margin:0px auto;)

field.name: margin_top
field.label: Margin Top
field.description: The top margin of the slider wrapper div

field.name: margin_bottom
field.label: Margin Bottom
field.description: The bottom margin of the slider wrapper div

field.name: margin_left
field.label: Margin Left
field.description: The left margin of the slider wrapper div

field.name: margin_right
field.label: Margin Right
field.description: The right margin of the slider wrapper div

field.name: clear_both
field.label: Add Clear:Both
field.description: Add clear:both div after the slider. This will make all the content after the slider to go down line.

field.name: jquery_noconflict
field.label: JQuery No Conflict Mode
field.description: Turns on / off jquery noconflict mode. You can play with this option when you have some javascript conflicts.

field.name: js_to_body
field.label: Put JS Includes To Body
field.description: Putting the js to body (in addition to head) is good for fixing some javascript conflicts of type: TypeError: jQuery('#showbiz_1_1').show().showbizpro is not a function

field.name: output_type
field.label: Output Filters Protection
field.description: Activate a protection against wordpress output filters that adds html blocks to the shortcode output like P and BR

field.name: debug_mode
field.label: Debug Mode
field.description: Allow to show output together with error messages
